nodes.npc_line: {player_title}. You have entered monitored space. This is fortunate. We require a biological agent for a task unsuitable for energy-based entities.

choices.text: What kind of task?
Why me?
I want no part of this.

nodes.npc_line: There is an object. A crystalline fragment. It fell from our vessel 12 of your days ago. It landed in a place your kind calls the Ashwood. We cannot retrieve it. You can.

choices.text: Why can't you get it yourself?
What does this fragment do?
What do I get in return?

nodes.npc_line: You were proximate. You are biological. You are capable of tolerating the Ashwood's conditions. Also: you appeared unoccupied. These factors combined to make you optimal, {player_name}.

choices.text: What is this task exactly?
I was NOT unoccupied.
I want no part of this.

nodes.npc_line: Noted. However: the fragment emits a frequency that will destabilize local fauna within {days_remaining} of your days. This will affect {settlement}. This will affect you. Reconsidering?

choices.text: Fine. Tell me about the task.
How bad are we talking?
Still no.

nodes.npc_line: The Ashwood contains high concentrations of iron-saturated soil. This disrupts our energy form and causes what you might describe as extreme discomfort. We choose not to experience this.

choices.text: Fair enough. What does the fragment look like?
What does this fragment do?
What do I get in return?

nodes.npc_line: It is a navigation core. Without it our vessel cannot plot departure. We are stranded in your orbit until it is recovered. This is embarrassing. Do not repeat that last statement.

choices.text: Your secret is safe. What does it look like?
What do I get in return?
Why can't you get it yourself?

nodes.npc_line: In return we will share coordinates. {reward} on your world — undiscovered by your kind. This is considered a fair exchange by our metrics.

choices.text: That sounds like a good deal. I'll do it.
What does the fragment look like?
Why can't you get it yourself?

nodes.npc_line: Our scans indicated minimal metabolic urgency and directionless locomotion. This registers as unoccupied in our taxonomy. We apologize if your taxonomy differs, {player_name}.

choices.text: It does. But fine. What's the task?
What do I get in return?

nodes.npc_line: Projection: aggressive behavior in local predators within 4 days. Structural damage to {settlement} within 7. Full ecological disruption within {days_remaining}. The word your kind uses is: bad.

choices.text: Okay. I'll do it. What do I need to know?
What do I get in return?

nodes.npc_line: {settlement} will be logged as a cautionary archive entry. This data will be useful to future observers. You have contributed to science, {player_name}. Farewell.

choices.text: Wait — fine, I'll do it.
[Walk away]

nodes.npc_line: It is approximately the size of your fist. Translucent. Blue-white in color. It pulses with a faint light at irregular intervals. Do not hold it for extended periods. Your biology will find it unpleasant.

choices.text: How unpleasant?
Understood. Where exactly in the Ashwood?
I'll do it. What do I get in return?

nodes.npc_line: Agreement confirmed, {player_name}. The Ashwood is 3 kilometers northeast of your current position. The fragment will be detectable by its pulse. Retrieve it and return here. You have {days_remaining} days. We will be watching.

choices.text: What does the fragment look like?
Understood. I'll return with it.

nodes.npc_line: Mild cellular vibration. Disorientation. Possible temporary chromatic vision disturbance — colors may appear incorrect for several hours. No permanent damage has been recorded. On most species.

choices.text: On MOST species?
Good enough. Where in the Ashwood?

nodes.npc_line: Our trajectory models place it near the northeastern edge. There is a dry riverbed. The fragment will have created a small impact site. Look for scorched earth and follow the pulse.

choices.text: Got it. I'll head out now.
What do I get in return again?

nodes.npc_line: Good. Do not lose it. Do not attempt to open it. Do not submerge it in water. Return within {days_remaining} days. If you do not return we will assume you have perished and seek another {player_title}. Good luck, {player_name}. This is sincerely meant.

choices.text: [Accept the quest]

nodes.npc_line: Your species has not been tested with this specific fragment configuration. You would be the first. We are reasonably confident the outcome will be acceptable. Reasonably.

choices.text: ...Fine. Where in the Ashwood?
I want more in return for this.
